macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Jones Crosses 50,000 for First Time as Market Rebounds
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average surged 1,206.95 points (2.5%) to 50,115.67 on February 6, 2026, marking its historic crossing of the 50,000 threshold. The rally was driven by technology stock recovery and Bitcoin stabilization above $70,000.

items.title: S&P 500 Posts Best Day Since May with 2% Gain
items.summary: The S&P 500 jumped 133.90 points (2%) to 6,932.30 on February 6, driven by chip company gains on AI spending expectations and improved U.S. consumer sentiment readings.

items.title: Nasdaq Composite Rallies 2.2% as Tech Stocks Recover
items.summary: The Nasdaq composite rose 490.63 points (2.2%) to 23,031.21 on February 6, rebounding from earlier week losses as technology stocks recovered and investors repositioned.

items.title: Treasury Yields Hit Multi-Month Lows Amid Fed Rate Cut Expectations
items.summary: U.S. Treasury yields fell to their lowest levels in months following weaker-than-expected labor market data, with markets increasingly confident the Federal Reserve will cut rates twice in 2026, with the first cut anticipated in summer.

items.title: S&P 500 Earnings Growth Beats Expectations at 13.0%
items.summary: The blended earnings growth rate for S&P 500 companies rose to 13.0% during the week, exceeding quarter-end growth expectations of 8.3%.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Cryptocurrency Market Cap Falls Below $2.4 Trillion Amid Two-Week Downturn
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization dropped below $2.4 trillion following a downturn over the past two weeks. Stablecoin market cap remains high despite the broader market decline.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cerebras Systems Raises $1 Billion Series H at $23 Billion Valuation
items.summary: Cerebras Systems closed a $1 billion Series H funding round led by Tiger Global, achieving a $23 billion post-money valuation to scale its wafer-scale AI infrastructure for on-prem and cloud deployments.

items.title: Positron AI Secures $230 Million Series B Funding at Over $1 Billion Valuation
items.summary: Positron AI raised $230 million in Series B funding to advance its energy-efficient inference hardware, including the Atlas server and upcoming Asimov chip, claiming up to 5x better efficiency than Nvidia's Rubin GPU.

items.title: Kong Unveils AI Connectivity Vision and Roadmap
items.summary: Kong introduced its AI Connectivity roadmap, featuring Kong Konnect and AI Gateway for governing and scaling AI across APIs, models, and agent communications, including new tools like KAi agentic API assistant.

items.title: Google Urges Post-Quantum Cryptography Adoption for AI and Cybersecurity
items.summary: Google called on governments and industry to prepare for quantum-era cybersecurity by adopting post-quantum cryptography, emphasizing its integration into AI systems and warning against global standards fragmentation.

items.title: Broadcom Predicted to Lead AI Chip Market in 2026 with Custom ASICs
items.summary: Analysts predict Broadcom will become a market leader alongside Nvidia by 2026 through custom AI ASICs for hyperscalers, expecting AI semiconductor revenue to double year-over-year in Q1.

items.title: Insight Jam Launches Mesh Lab for AI-Era Work and Learning Frameworks
items.summary: Insight Jam launched Mesh Lab, a year-long series of expert discussions to re-architect human capabilities in work, education, and leadership amid AI integration.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox and PlayStation Unveil Strong 2026 Lineups Outpacing Nintendo
items.summary: Xbox features major titles like Fable, Halo, Gears of War, and Forza, while PlayStation announces Marvel’s Wolverine, Marathon, Saros, and Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls. Nintendo faces pressure with a lighter schedule for the Switch 2's second year.

items.title: New Turn-Based RPGs Released This Week Including Dragon Quest VII Remake
items.summary: Square Enix's Dragon Quest VII Reimagined launched February 5 on multiple platforms, alongside The Bell Echoes in Early Access, Dead Grid full release, and Monster Train 2 DLC Destiny of the Railforged.

items.title: Top Chinese VR Game Machine Manufacturers Lead 2026 Arcade Innovations
items.summary: EPARK, UNIS, and Andamiro top Chinese VR arcade manufacturers pioneering immersive tech for family entertainment centers with advanced simulators and coin-operated games.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Highlights Multiplatform Shift as Hardware Sales Decline
items.summary: Recent Nintendo Direct showcases normalized multiplatform publishing trends amid sliding hardware sales, discussed in Xbox Expansion Pass podcast.

items.title: Cannibal Halfling Gaming Weekend RPG News Update
items.summary: Weekly RPG roundup covers top sellers, industry developments, and key news from the past week on February 7.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
